i currently have this laptop (that i'm ircing from) and my server together on an ethernet switch, sharing the ip 137.229.82.30. i want to connect from here to the server, but i'll also want to connect from elsewhere (other ip addresses). i don't know how ethernet switches work, is there a protocol for addressing a specific machine at a particular address?

you two systems you have are on a lan (local area network)  they each have an address on that lan.  on the internet they are seen as having the same address.  so to find the address of each you can do the command ifconfig  at a term.  this is the address you will login with on ssh localy
if you plan to connect to them from outside your local network from the Internet to one or both then you will require setup of your router port forwarding.
